metadata.title: CVE-2021-2032 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Information Schema). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.32 andprior and 8.0.22 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows lowprivileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized read access to a subset of MySQL Server accessibledata. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.3 (Confidentiality impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-2032` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-common - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
mariadb-10.0 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
percona-server-5.6 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
